instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..
definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2016 - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. SSD Failure.
threads.message:
I am attempting to recover data off of an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2016 Touchbar - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. It refuses to boot either one of the two accounts, with filevault enabled, but will boot into Guest mode. I have also made several attempts in connecting the drive via Target disk mode. The machine successfully enters Target disk mode but is not able to connect by USB to any of the four USB-C ports. I have tried two different machines with two different cables. If I boot off external drive (10.13 High Sierra) the machine only stays alive for 30 seconds after entering desktop. The screen goes black and about a minute later it reboots. I believe the drive is failing and was hoping someone had success with data recovery...

Error report:

panic(cpu 0 caller 0xffffff7f9cb594a7): nvme: "Fatal error occurred. CSTS=0x1 US[1]=0x0 US[0]=0x113 VID=0x144d DID=0xa804

. FW Revision=CXS5EA0Q\n"@/BuildRoot/Library/Caches/com.apple.xbs/Sources/IONVMeFamily/IONVMeFamily-470.40.4/IONVMeController.cpp:5258

Backtrace (CPU 0), Frame : Return Address

Thanks in advance.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2016 - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. SSD Failure.
threads.message: Machine stays on if you boot USB macOS with J9600 disconnected?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2016 - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. SSD Failure.
threads.message:
Machine stays on with J9600 disconnected. Also tried booting into USB with J9600 connected and then unmounting SSD right after desktop is shown. Machine stays on. It shuts off after a few mins when attempting to read data using R-Studio.
[ATTACH type="full"]60660[/ATTACH]
